history.content:
"In this case, how will my course GPA(61AB, 70) be calculated?"

It is prorated for 1 unit 47B, and 4 units for 61A, 4 units for CS70.

 

"Do I need to complete 47B before declaring the major?""

No. You do not need to await completing 47B. You can do it right now if this is the semester where you have "enrolled" in all the pre-requisites for declaration. Do not have to wait for it to be graded/complete as the department gets that information when they are making the decision post semester end.

FYI : I am also currently enrolled in 47B for Spring 2022.

children.subject: Yes certainly you can reach me at yatrik@berkeley.edu
Awesome, thanks for your clarification. Also, can I get your contact by any chance? I am a little confused about how 47B works.(Never took a self-paced course before)

history.content:
Yatrik is correct, though we won't declare you until after the end of the semester, when we get your 47B grade. But you can apply at any time during the semester through May 30.

We will take the average of 61A at 4 units, 70 at 4 units and 47B at 1 unit, so this class won't impact your GPA for declaration all that much.

Note: You can't take this path unless you're a transfer student who took a 61B equivalent at your previous school.

Hi, I am a transfer student that intends to declare CS Major. I have complete CS70 and CS61A. I was approved to use some of the courses I took before to waive 61B and take CS47B instead. In this case, how will my course GPA(61AB, 70) be calculated? Do I need to complete 47B before declaring the major?
history.subject: Declaring CS Major with CS47B
